alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 08 at 4:09PM AKDT until October 09 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * WHERE...Turnagain Arm, Anchorage Hillside, and higher elevations. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty southeasterly winds will impact Turnagain Arm, Anchorage Hillside, and higher elevations today. Peak gusts likely occured around midday. Some locations in the Anchorage Hillside with channeled terrain will see localized gusts up to 80 mph. A short lull is expected around 7 PM with a resurgence at 10 PM, tapering off by 1 AM. Within the Anchorage Bowl, expect southeast wind gusts up to 30 mph.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
